name: ApplicationBackup
description: Backup files, folder before update. Version: 1.0.0
author: NeedCode

inputs.name: MachineName
inputs.label: Application Server
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name or IP of the server where the files are located.

inputs.name: SourcePath
inputs.label: Source Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: The source folder or UNC path that the copy pattern(s) will be run from.

inputs.name: AdminPassword
inputs.label: Admin Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password for administrator login for machines. It can accept variable defined in Release definitions as '$(passwordVariable)'. You may mark variable type as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: DestinationMachineName
inputs.label: Backup Server
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name or IP of the server to which the backup should be copied. If empty that the 'Target Folder' is UNC path or it is on the 'Application Server'.

inputs.name: DestinationPath
inputs.label: Target Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Target folder or UNC path files will copy to. You can use [variables](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=550988). Example: $(Build.BuildNumber)

inputs.name: CreateArchive
inputs.label: Compress Files
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this option is selected, then a zip file will be created in the destination folder.

inputs.name: IncludeRootFolder
inputs.label: Include root folder to archive
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this option is selected, then include folder to the archive file

inputs.name: ArchiveFileName
inputs.label: Archive file to create
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the name of the archive file to create. You can use [variables](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=550988). For example, to create Backup_$(Build.BuildNumber).zip.
